page.title: 08STOKE DOYLE VILLAGE SCHOOL
page.content: Like many villages round here Stoke Doyle has a village school which is now closed because of the decline in population. The school has just been sold and will be converted into a private house as has happened in Lowick, Tywell and Sudborough. At one time the school, the pub and the nearby church were the centre of the community. The school was used quite often for activities like keep-fit, the harvest-supper and church fetes which raised money for different parish activities. In the day time the school was of course used for teaching the village children of primary age and Sunday School also took place in the building. However, unlike Barnwell,Glapthorn and Polebrook the Stoke Doyle School is no longer considered to be viable.
